author: Kevin Krammer
message:
very cool!
I am wondering if this could be turned into a git command somehow that would allow things like
git reviewboard push [optional SHA, otherwise HEAD] [optional id if updating instead of creating]

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message:
(sorry for the late answer, was on vacation)

If you have a command named git-foo in $PATH then you can invoke it as "git foo" as well (only shell completion won't work), but what you are referring to is a bit different: you want to post a patch for review, while reviewboard-am is about applying an existing patch to your tree, or am I confused?

author: Daniel Vrátil
message:
I've been using reviewboard-am since I learned about it about 5 months ago and it's a really nice tool, so big thank you!

I have local version with two small improvements:
1) -pN option identical to git am -pN (or patch -pN)
2) automatically filling REVIEW: and BUG: keywords in the commit message

Diff: http://paste.kde.org/p1543d...

If you like it, feel free to push it :)
